name: Minto Suite Hotel

reviews.text: The location is excellent, right downtown, but easily accessible by bus from the airport. You just need to take Bus 97 from the YOW Airport and get off at the Albert/Kent stop, and it is 1 short block away (2-min walk) from the hotel. (I think there might also be a shuttle bus service, but I didn't wait for the shuttle bus.) It takes about 20-25 minutes on the bus. The bus displays the next stop name, so it is really very convenient.
reviews.title: Lots of space, downtown, yet easy access from Airport

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night with a friend's friend. We are both attending a wedding, so we decided to share a hotel room. It was a one-bedroom suite, with separate bedroom and living space. It has two closets，two large bathrooms (one is a two-piece), two large TVs, and the bedroom space has two queen-size beds. So it was very convenient for us. In addition, it has a desk, a full-size sofa, a coffee table, a round dining table, chairs, a dressing table, and a large chest of drawers. It even has a balcony, though it is quite small.
reviews.title: great value, perfect family location, free bikes

reviews.text: It has a kitchenette, but it is quite small, without a stove (as far as I can tell). It does have a microwave, an electric kettle, a coffee maker, a small fridge, and some plates, etc. Free Granny Smith apples are available at the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: good location, free bicycles, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers free bicycle rentals, which can be a very useful thing for people who want to explore the capital city.
reviews.title: Ottawa's thriftiest, most full-service hotel - for biz &/or pleasure

reviews.text: The underground parking costs only $8 per night, with in-and-out privilege.
reviews.title: Stay here again

reviews.text: Had another great stay in this hotel. We had a two bedroom suite which has plenty or space to be a home away from home, room was clean and tidy as is the whole Hotel, All the staff we met during our stay were excellent and very friendly. This hotel is in a perfect location for visiting Ottawa.
reviews.title: Great Hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in August and enjoyed out stay greatly. The bellman was terrific, the elevators move very fast ( be aware if you get motion sickness); the room was clean and spacious. We had a one bedroom with kitchenette, a great option for families. We brought breakfast food for convenience and nice cold beer for late afternoon refreshments before going back out for the evening. We used the pull out for our daughter and had two double beds in the room for additional sleeping space which is great when you are generally used to a king bed!
reviews.title: Great property downtown Ottawa

reviews.text: Conveniet to local attractions including Parliament, museums, Byward Market
reviews.title: Thank you, Minto

reviews.text: Ah, Minto Suites Hotel, as I sit in my dodgy Montreal Hotel I remember you so fondly. You had a pool, a fitness room, a pull-out sofa, a little kitchenette. You were on a nice street and your free bike rentals were so much appreciated. The room was clean and the windows opened. The air was fresh. Minto, where are you now? I wanted to stay forever.
reviews.title: Great suite in a great location.

reviews.text: Though you were a little further from downtown than other places I had stayed at in the past, you were a nice walk, a chance to stroll past the parliament buildings on my way to the Byward market and the National Gallery, and a chance to peek past the buildings at the canal set behind them.
reviews.title: My stay in Ottawa
A bit disappointing
reviews.text: We had booked a suite with a queen size bed and our son would sleep on the bedcouch. The bed couch was from a bad quality, and ous on ended up sleeping on the couch itself, more comfortable. Size of suite was good. Kitchen well equipped. Minuses: pay for Parking ( appr. Usd 17 p/n)' pay for wi fi (??!!), Usd 11 per 24 hrs, plus the wi fi was very weak and slow. Iexpected more quality for the money I payed. Will not return here!

It was sold to us as a secret four star hotel by an on-line travel service. It is not four star, but we did not pay 4 star price either. The place is clean and nice, suites are very spacious, one bathroom and one half bathroom. Service is courteous. Internet is extra, so is breakfast, and parking is expensive but in place.
reviews.title: Overrated by the travel agency but still good enough for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 5 days in Ottawa and was very pleased with the Minto Suites.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Great value for a room with two bathrooms, kitchenette, bedroom & living room. And very quiet.
reviews.title: Superb value.

reviews.text: Good location, 10 minutes walk from Parliament Hill.
reviews.title: Recommend for price and location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ottawa Minto about 40 times in 2011. The staff is very friendly and accommodating - even upgrade you once in a while without having to ask for an upgrade. Parking is accessible, elevators are very fast, hotel restaurant is fantastic (food, service, prices, etc), location is very desirable (right downtown and close to everything). There is an excellent food court with shops, a wine store, and lots of choices for lunch.
reviews.title: Great hotel, slightly dated

reviews.text: The rooms, although pretty dated, are very large and some have full kitchens, which is great for making your own breakfast and snacks. The beds and couches are so-so - also noticed that the upgraded rooms have down covers, whereas as other's don't. Usually when asked for a down cover, it was brought to my room, however, there were nights when there were none left. The lobby is freezing. The gym is decent - enough machines that I never had to wait.
reviews.title: Excellent quality/price ratio

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, good experience. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Smelly Room in a Dated Property
Nice hotel, but getting dated
reviews.text: Pros:
- Very modern rooms/furniture;
reviews.title: My best Ottawa hotel experience

description: Multistory All-Suite Hotel located near downtown shopping, business & entertainment district.
